results.title: Motion Pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company, 1904-1909
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company (Philadelphia).
Contents: Bold bank robbery (1904)—She would be an actress (1904)—Drunkard’s child (1909)—An Unexpected guest (1909)
Films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Motion pictures produced by George Melies 1903-1904
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced and directed by French filmmaker George Melies and restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: The Inn where no man rests (1903)—A Spiritualist photographer (1903)—The Kingdom of the fairies (1903)—The Magic lantern (1903)—The Clockmaker’s dream (1904)—The Cook in trouble (1904)—The Mermaid (1904)

results.title: Motion and time study
results.creator_credit: Gil Greene and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: Outlines the concept of motion and time study and offers specific exercises for class instruction. Several different motions common to industrial production are presented and then analysed by motion and time study techniques. The motions are again presented, this time without identification, for class recognition and analysis.

results.title: Motion and time
results.brief_description: A study of our relation to time and motion. Depicts the changing concepts of our view of time, motion and space, from Copernicus to Einstein. Principles of Einstein’s theory of relativity are explained through an animated segment, demonstrating that measurements of both space and time are not absolute but are functions of motion.
results.description: A study of our relation to time and motion. Depicts the changing concepts of our view of time, motion and space, from Copernicus to Einstein. Principles of Einstein’s theory of relativity are explained through an animated segment, demonstrating that measurements of both space and time are not absolute but are functions of motion.

results.title: Motion
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and Jack Lieb Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dance as an art form”
Part of a series designed to introduce dance as an art form. Illustrates how commonplace actions can be sensed and then transformed through selection, arrangement and skillful performance. Narrated by Murray Louis.
